item.title: US Dollar Index takes it on the chin while Trump remains silent over leaked gradual tariff import schemes - FXStreet
item.description:
US Dollar Index takes it on the chin while Trump remains silent over leaked gradual tariff import schemes

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: FXStreet

The US Dollar Index (DXY) is struggling amid softer economic data and uncertainty surrounding the Trump administration's tariff plans.

  • The US Dollar Index dipped below 110.00.
  • December Producer Price Index (PPI) reports were softer than expected.
  • Markets are wary of President-elect Donald Trump's comments on tariffs.
  • Economic calendar highlights upcoming Consumer Price Index (CPI) release on Wednesday.
"The monthly core PPI gauge increased by 0.0%, below the 0.3% expected."

The article discusses the potential ramifications of the soft economic indicators and the uncertainty surrounding future tariff implementations under Trump, which could influence the market stability going forward.

item.title: M Rajeshwar Rao to head MPC, T Rabi Sankar in-charge of financial market ops in RBI's portfolio rejig for... - Moneycontrol
item.description:
M Rajeshwar Rao to head MPC, T Rabi Sankar in-charge of financial market ops in RBI's portfolio rejig for deputy guvs

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has announced a reshuffle of portfolios for its deputy governors, effective January 15.

  • M. Rajeshwar Rao has been appointed to head the monetary policy department.
  • T Rabi Sankar will oversee financial market operations.
  • Swaminathan Janakiraman will manage financial stability and financial inclusion departments.
  • This reshuffle comes following the end of Michael Debabrata Patra's tenure as the senior deputy governor in charge of monetary policy.
“The Central government has already initiated the process of finding Patra's successor,”

This strategic reshuffle aims to enhance the efficiency and focus of the RBI's leadership in addressing current economic challenges.

item.title: M Rajeshwar Rao to head MPC, T Rabi Sankar in-charge of financial market ops in RBI's portfolio rejig - Moneycontrol
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 15: IRFC, Adani Green, Optiemus Infracom, Hindustan Zinc and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 15: IRFC, Adani Green, Optiemus Infracom, Hindustan Zinc and more

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

Today's stocks to watch include IRFC, Adani Green, Optiemus Infracom, Hindustan Zinc, Sula Vineyards, Shoppers Stop, and more, detailing significant business activities and developments.

  • IRFC: Lowest bidder for ₹3,167 crore coal block financing in Jharkhand.
  • Adani Green: Expanded operational renewable capacity to 11,666.1 MW with new wind project in Gujarat.
  • Optiemus Infracom: Partnership with Taiwan’s KunWay Technology for drone manufacturing in India.
  • Hindustan Zinc: Levied with ₹92.55 crore in penalties related to GST issues.
  • Sula Vineyards: Q3 FY25 report shows net revenue down 0.7%, but tourism revenue grew 11.5% YoY.
  • Shoppers Stop: Reported a net profit increase of 41.5% YoY.
  • Allcargo Gati: Achieved 8% YoY growth in business volume for December 2024.
  • Hathway Cable: Net profit down 39.3% YoY in Q3 FY25.
  • Escorts Kubota: High Court dismissed IT department's appeal for AY 1986-87.
  • Morepen Laboratories: Approved the hiving off medical devices business to a new subsidiary.
  • Welspun Corp: Signed MoU with Saudi Aramco for a pipe manufacturing facility.

“The project is being undertaken by Patratu Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Ltd (PVUNL).” - IRFC announcement.

The stock market looks set for potentially impactful movements as companies report key financial updates and strategic partnerships. Investors should monitor these developments closely.

item.title: US Dollar Index takes a step back while Trump remains silent over leaked comments on gradual imported tariff schemes - FXStreet
item.description:
US Dollar Index takes it on the chin while Trump remains silent over leaked gradual tariff import schemes

Date: January 14, 2025   Source: FXStreet

The US Dollar Index (DXY) is experiencing a drop following the release of the December Producer Price Index, causing traders to reassess their positions ahead of the upcoming Consumer Price Index release.

  • The US Dollar Index dips below the psychological level of 110.00.
  • Comments from the Trump administration hint at a slow rollout of tariffs to prevent inflation.
  • The Producer Price Index showed softer figures than expected, affecting market expectations for the CPI.
"Traders are easing their US Dollar position heading into Wednesday's CPI release."

With the economic calendar scheduled to provide more insights, traders remain cautious and anticipate potential volatility in the DXY due to forthcoming speeches from Federal Reserve officials.

item.title: IISc and Tata Group partner to establish medical school in Bengaluru - Deccan Herald
item.description:
IISc and Tata Group Partner to Establish Medical School in Bengaluru

Published: 14 January 2025, 14:36 IST

The Tata Group will contribute Rs 500 crore to the establishment of a new medical school at IISc, aiming to create a center for clinical research and medical education in India.

  • The Tata IISc Medical School will focus on specialized fields such as oncology, cardiology, and public health.
  • It will offer integrated MD-PhD and dual degree programs to develop physician-scientists and medical technologists.
  • The school seeks to integrate clinical practice with scientific research.
“We are very grateful to the Tata Group for their generosity,” said Prof G Rangarajan, Director, IISc.

The collaboration aims to innovate affordable healthcare solutions for India and beyond.

item.title: Wholesale Price Inflation Rises To 2.37% In December - News18
item.description:
Wholesale Price Inflation Rises To 2.37% In December

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 Source: News18

Wholesale price inflation rose to 2.37 per cent in December 2024, led by a spike in manufactured products even though prices of food items eased, according to government data.

  • The Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation was 1.89 per cent in November 2024 and 0.86 per cent in December 2023.
  • Inflation in food items eased to 8.47 per cent in December 2024 from 8.63 per cent in November.
  • Inflation in potato remained high at 93.20 per cent, while onion saw a spike to 16.81 per cent in December.
  • Fuel and power category recorded a deflation of 3.79 per cent in December.
“Retail inflation data released on Monday showed that consumer price index (CPI) based inflation eased to 4-month low of 5.22 per cent in December on easing food prices.”

This increase in wholesale price inflation reflects underlying pressures in the economy, despite some easing in food prices, which may influence future consumer prices.

item.title: Reliance Industries Q3 results 2025 date, time: Mukesh Ambani-led RIL's quarterly earnings, analyst meet schedule - ET Now
item.description:
Reliance Industries Q3 results 2025 date, time

Updated: January 14, 2025 from ET Now

Billionaire Mukesh Ambani-led India’s largest conglomerate RIL is set to announce its quarterly earnings for the October-December 2024 period soon. The oil-to-telecom conglomerate has released the earnings and analyst meet schedule.

  • Reliance Industries to hold a Board of Directors meeting on January 16, 2025, to approve quarterly results.
  • Financial results typically announced around 7:30 PM IST.
  • Goldman Sachs anticipates a 5% growth in Q3 core EBITDA compared to last quarter.
  • The stock has seen a decline of over 22% in the last 6 months.
According to BSE analytics, Reliance Industries stock has slipped nearly 10% in the last 10 years while rising 8.77% in the last 2 years.

This upcoming financial disclosure is critical for investors and stakeholders to gauge the company's performance amid mixed signals from different business segments.

item.title: Why retail inflation pinched less despite remaining above 5% in December - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Why Retail Inflation Was Less Painful Despite Being Above 5% in December

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

This article discusses the notable decrease in the perceived impact of retail inflation in December, which remains above 5%. It highlights that for the first time in 10 months, around 75 items have experienced deflation.

  • Retail inflation stayed above 5% in December.
  • Approximately 75 items showed deflation for the first time in 10 months.
  • This indicates a softening effect on consumers despite the inflation rate.
"December marks the first time in 10 months that around 75 items witnessed deflation."

The article suggests that the dynamics of inflation are changing, as several items no longer contribute to the rising inflation trend, providing some relief to consumers.

item.title: Hero Destini 125 launched in India at Rs. 80,450 - BikeWale
item.description:
Hero Destini 125 Launched in India at Rs. 80,450

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Bikewale

Hero MotoCorp has launched the Destini 125 scooter in India, available in three variants with prices starting at Rs. 80,450.

  • Available in three variants: VX, ZX, ZX+
  • Powered by a 125cc engine producing 9bhp and 10.4Nm
  • Top-end model features smartphone connectivity and advanced features
“The Hero Destini 125 rivals the TVS Jupiter 125 and Honda Activa 125.”

The new Hero Destini 125 is designed to appeal to modern consumers and includes several innovative features, making it a strong contender in the scooter market.

item.title: Gold sees small bounce while traders brace for Trump's feedback on gradual tariff implementation - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Prices Stabilize as Traders Await Trump's Tariff Remarks

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: FXStreet

Gold prices are showing resilience amidst nervous anticipation of comments from President-elect Donald Trump regarding gradual tariff increases. Current pricing is around $2,670.

  • Gold is witnessing a slight uptick ahead of the US trading session.
  • Trump's administration is considering a gradual approach to tariffs to mitigate inflation risks.
  • The upcoming release of key economic data, including the PPI and CPI, may influence market reactions.
  • Current 10-year benchmark rates are falling, providing some relief to traders.
  • Long positions in gold are on the rise, indicating market sentiment.
"The Trump administration seeks to avoid an inflation shock by implementing tariffs gradually."

The current market dynamics surrounding gold reflect cautious optimism as traders monitor political and economic developments closely.

item.title: Hero MotoCorp launches New Hero Destini 125 - Business Standard
item.description:
Hero MotoCorp Launches New Hero Destini 125

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Capital Market - Live News

Hero MotoCorp is set to stimulate the 125cc scooter segment with the launch of the new Destini 125.

The New Destini 125 showcases Hero MotoCorp's dedication to innovation with 30 patent applications and industry-first features, such as an illuminated start switch and autocancel winkers, for improved rider convenience and safety.

  • Available in three variants: VX V at Rs. 80,450, ZX V at Rs. 89,300, and ZX+ at Rs. 90,300 (Introductory Ex-Showroom price in Delhi).
  • Segment-leading mileage of 59 kmpl, making it an ideal choice for families.
  • Features generous legroom and a spacious floorboard for comfort.
  • Longer seat designed for ergonomic rider experience.
“We are thrilled to introduce the new Hero Destini 125, a symbol of style, convenience, and advanced technology, designed for the modern rider.” - Ranjivjit Singh, Chief Business Officer - India Business Unit, Hero MotoCorp

This innovative 125cc scooter redefines industry standards and solidifies Hero MotoCorp's position in the market.

item.title: Mumbai-based Shanti Gold International Limited files DRHP for IPO | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Shanti Gold International Limited Files for IPO

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Mumbai-based Shanti Gold International Limited has filed a Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI to raise funds through an IPO.

  • The IPO includes up to 18 million fresh equity shares at a face value of ₹10.
  • Funds will be used for capital expenditure, working capital, and debt repayment.
  • Allocation: 50% for qualified institutional buyers, 15% for non-institutional bidders, and 35% for retail individual bidders.
  • The promoters have extensive experience in the jewellery industry.
  • Expected growth in the Indian jewellery market by 13.1% y-o-y in CY24.
“The surge in demand for gold jewellery is due to the growing middle-class population and their increasing disposable income levels.”

The filing of the DRHP marks an important step towards the company's IPO, signaling its growth intentions in the expanding jewellery market.

item.title: LIC share price hits new 1-year low, down over 32% from record high | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
LIC Share Price Hits New 1-Year Low, Down Over 32% from Record High

Date: January 14, 2024

Source: Live Mint

Shares of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC), India's largest life insurer, touched a new 52-week low of ₹806 apiece on January 14, breaking below its previous low of ₹820. However, the stock managed to close the session 2% higher at ₹825.

  • The stock has lost nearly 30% of its value since August.
  • Currently down 32.5% from its all-time high of ₹1,221.
  • LIC experienced a 13% drop in individual Annualized Premium Equivalent (APE) for December 2024.
  • Year-to-date growth for the sector remains at 14.5%, but LIC's growth nosedived to 4.4% in Q3.
  • LIC maintained a dominant 64.4% market share in group business despite falling premiums.
  • Total premiums decreased by 41% year-on-year, reaching ₹13,523 crore in December.
  • New surrender regulations have led to reduced policy counts and affected APE growth.
"LIC has struggled in Q3 post-surrender norms and the resultant commission changes. While it is now cheap at 0.6x FY26e EV after adjusting for MTM losses, continued contraction in new business implies we wait for a better opportunity." - JM Financial

This downturn highlights the need for strategic adjustments within LIC to navigate regulatory and market challenges.

item.title: TCS CEO K Krithivasan: We had one of the 'worst toplines', but one of the ... - The Times of India
item.description:
TCS CEO K Krithivasan Addresses Poor Topline Performance

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, TCS CEO K Krithivasan acknowledged the company faced one of its 'worst toplines' while discussing strategies to recover growth.

  • The company experienced significant challenges in revenue generation.
  • Krithivasan emphasized the need for adaptation to market conditions.
  • Future strategies will focus on innovation and customer engagement.
“We had one of the worst toplines, but we are committed to improving our performance,” K Krithivasan stated.

This address highlights the resilience and strategic focus of TCS in navigating through difficult financial periods.

item.title: US Inflation: PPI, CPI Release Dates, DXY Analysis & Market Impact - MarketPulse
item.description:
US Inflation: PPI, CPI Release Dates, DXY Analysis & Market Impact

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: MarketPulse

The US Dollar Index (DXY) is set to respond to new US inflation data (PPI and CPI) releases later this week. The market anticipates fluctuations in response to expected economic changes.

  • PPI data set to release on January 14, CPI following on January 15.
  • Current support for DXY at 109.57, with resistance at 110.00.
  • Trump team rumored to consider gradual tariffs.
“Tariff concerns continue to support the US Dollar as fears mount around the impact it will have on US inflation.”

Overall, markets are closely watching inflation reports as they could significantly influence the US Dollar's trajectory.

item.title: IndiGo passenger criticises crew for ‘unprofessional behaviour’ during 5-hour flight delay. Airline reacts - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Passenger criticised IndiGo over a 5-hour delay, poor service, and rude crew; airline responded but faced backlash.

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

IndiGo Airlines is under scrutiny after a Kolkata passenger, Ritham Bhattacharjee, criticized their handling of a delayed flight. He described their service as appalling, sharing a video of his altercation with crew members.

  • The flight from Kolkata to Chennai was delayed by five hours.
  • Passengers remained on the aircraft with minimal compensation provided.
  • Bhattacharjee reported unprofessional behaviour from the cabin crew during the flight.
  • IndiGo's response included a standard apology, but did not alleviate his frustrations.
“It seems that IndiGo’s focus on being a low-cost airline has come at the expense of customer satisfaction.”

Social media users echoed Bhattacharjee's sentiments, expressing outrage and critiquing the airline's standards.

item.title: IndiGo passenger criticises crew for ‘unprofessional behaviour’ during 5-hour flight delay. Airlines reacts - Hindustan Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Market Wrap, January 14: Indices rebound after 4 days of decline; SENSEX rises 170 pts, NIFTY50 ends at 23,207.60 - Upstox
item.description:
Market Wrap, January 14: Indices rebound after 4 days of decline; SENSEX rises 170 pts, NIFTY50 ends at 23,207.60

Date: January 14, Source: PTI

After four days of sharp decline, the equity benchmark indices, SENSEX and NIFTY50, bounced back on easing retail inflation and a rebound in global markets.

  • The SENSEX rose 169.62 points (0.22%) to settle at 76,499.63.
  • The NIFTY50 climbed 90.10 points (0.39%) to 23,176.05.
  • Retail inflation declined to a four-month low of 5.22% in December.
  • Adani Ports surged over 5%, while HCLTech dropped over 8% after disappointing earnings.
  • Foreign institutional investors offloaded equities worth ₹4,892.84 crore.
“The CEO expressed optimism for improvement in the demand environment and discretionary spending.”

The indices showed signs of recovery amid easing inflation and a positive trend in global markets, signaling potential stability after recent fluctuations.

item.title: Nifty 50 Prediction Tomorrow, Wednesday, Jan 15: Bullish Harami Cross chart pattern; Check support and resistance - ET Now
item.description:
Nifty 50 Prediction Today, Wednesday, Jan 15: Bullish Harami Cross chart pattern; Check support and resistance

Date: Updated Jan 14, 2025 | Source: ET NOW

The Nifty 50 index shows signs of a potential short-term recovery following recent declines, bolstered by the formation of a Bullish Harami Cross pattern.

  • Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty rebounded after four days of decline.
  • Nifty closed up 90.10 points or 0.39 percent at 23,176.05.
  • Experts suggest minor pullbacks towards resistance zones are selling opportunities.
  • The Bullish Harami pattern may indicate a possible short-term recovery.
  • Immediate supports and resistances are at 23000-22670 and 23340-23500, respectively.
“The near-term trend of Nifty remains weak. This upside bounce could be a sell on rise opportunity around 23350 levels.” - Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst at HDFC Securities

Despite the bullish signals, caution is advised as underlying downtrends continue to prevail, suggesting that traders should closely monitor resistance levels for potential sell-offs.

item.title: India’s disinflation progress could derail amid sharp rupee depreciation - Moneycontrol
item.description:
India’s Disinflation Progress Could Derail Amid Sharp Rupee Depreciation

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian rupee has depreciated by 3.2% against the US dollar, which may hinder the country’s disinflationary progress, leading to higher import costs and inflation.

  • The Indian rupee has faced a notable depreciation, becoming the second least volatile currency after the Hong Kong dollar.
  • Experts warn that increased import costs may translate into imported inflation.
  • Economists indicate that sectors reliant on imported raw materials will face escalating costs, impacting consumer prices and spending.
  • Retail inflation in India saw a decline to 5.22% in December, thanks to easing food prices.

Aditi Gupta, Economist at Bank of Baroda: “Sectors heavily dependent on imported raw materials are likely to witness escalation in costs due to higher input prices, impacting margins.”

The sharp depreciation of the rupee poses significant challenges to India's economic stability, making it essential for policymakers to address the potential inflationary pressures while supporting growth.

item.title: 90-hour workweek row: ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri says ‘would not do it’, bats for flexibility, employee empowerment | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri Advocates for Employee Empowerment Amid 90-Hour Workweek Debate

Date: January 14, 2023 Source: Live Mint

In light of the recent 90-hour workweek controversy, ITC Ltd Chairman Sanjiv Puri emphasized the importance of aligning employees with the company's vision rather than focusing strictly on work hours. He highlighted the company's flexible work environment, including work-from-home options.

  • Sanjiv Puri remarked that ITC would not enforce strict work hour limits.
  • The focus should be on employee engagement and contribution to the company's goals.
  • Puri described a vision analogy, comparing workers’ perspectives to builders constructing a castle.
  • He mentioned the flexibility offered by ITC, including two work-from-home days per week.
“What do you do sitting at home? How long can you stare at your wife, and how long can the wife stare at the husband.” - Sanjiv Puri

In conclusion, Puri advocates that organizations should enable individuals to fulfill their potential rather than merely track hours worked.

item.title: UK’s CMA slaps Google Search and its 90%+ market share with an antitrust investigation - TechCrunch
item.description:
UK’s CMA slaps Google Search and its 90%+ market share with an antitrust investigation

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: TechCrunch

The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) in the UK has launched its first antitrust investigation of 2025, focusing on Google's dominance in the search market and AI search initiatives. Stakeholders have until February 3 to respond to the investigation.

  • The CMA will explore Google's market dominance, particularly in search and advertising.
  • This investigation is one of two that the CMA plans to conduct this month targeting Big Tech.
  • Google currently accounts for over 90% of all general search queries in the UK, impacting over 200,000 businesses that advertise on its platform.
  • Potential outcomes could include conduct requirements or pro-competition actions.
  • The CMA is assessing whether Google suppresses competition and uses consumer data without consent.
  • Concerns over Google's preference for its own services and the impact of AI technologies are also under scrutiny.
“Millions of people and businesses across the UK rely on Google’s search and advertising services.” - Sarah Cardell, Chief Executive of the CMA

The investigation could usher in significant changes to ensure a competitive landscape in online search, reflecting broader challenges posed by AI innovations in the tech industry.

item.title: ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors - News18
item.description:
ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: News18

Shares of ITC Hotels have been credited to the Demat accounts of eligible ITC shareholders following the allotment. The allotment was announced on Saturday, January 11, and the shares were credited to Demat accounts on Monday, January 13.

  • ITC shareholders received an SMS notification from their depository regarding the credit of ITC Hotels shares to their Demat accounts.
  • The share allotment ratio is 10:1 according to the demerger scheme.
  • On January 11, ITC Ltd announced the allotment of shares to shareholders as of the record date January 6, 2025.
  • A total of 125.11 crore equity shares of ITC Hotels have been allotted.
  • The shares are currently shown as a dummy ticker in Demat accounts.
  • ITC Hotels will be listed on the NSE and BSE, expected before mid-February 2025.
“The Board of Directors of ITC Hotels Limited met on January 11, 2025, and allotted 125,11,71,040 equity shares of Re 1 each,” said ITC in the filing.

The credit of ITC Hotels shares marks a significant event for shareholders, as it transitions to a separate entity with expectations of an official market listing soon.
